description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to improve water resource and fisheries management in selected areas of the Lower Mekong Basin.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A, 4(a) | Description :Ensure, and cause the PCMU and any individual or entity working on Part 1 of the Project to ensure, that the Financing or part thereof shall not be used to finance the Processing of a Dam in themainstream Mekong; | Frequency :Quarterly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A, 4(b) | Description :Ensure that the PCMU implements a time recording system |Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, A, 4(c) | Description :Include a provision in the terms of reference of the independentauditor for Part 1 of the Project to ensure that only the costs related directly to the Project are expended or charged by the PCMUunder the Financing and that no amount is used directly or indirectly for the Processing of a Dam in the mainstream Mekong. |Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I. A, 5(a) | Description :Carry out jointly with the Association, no later than June 30,2015, or such later date as the Association may notify to the Recipient, a midterm review to assess the status of the Project, asmeasured against the performance indicators set forth above in Section II.A.1 (b) of Schedule 2. | Due Date :15-Jun-2015

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A, 1 | Description :For the purpose of monitoring the overall progress of the Project,facilitate the resolution of regional technical matters, and ensure coherence and consistency in implementation of the Project, aProject Steering Committee shall be maintained, throughout the period of implementation of the Project, with a mandate, terms ofreference and composition that is satisfactory to the Association | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A, 2 | Description :For the purpose of overseeing the implementation of Parts 2 and 3 ofthe Project, the Recipient shall maintain a National Steering Committee—Lao PDR, throughout the period of implementation of Parts 2and 3 of the Project, to be chaired by a senior official appointed by the head of the MONRE, with a mandate, terms of reference andcomposition that shall be satisfactory to the Association, | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A, 3 | Description :For the purpose of implementation, coordination and monitoring of theactivities under Part 2 of the Project and coordination and monitoring of the activities under Part 3.1(a) of the Project the MONREshall maintain throughout the period of implementation of th eProject, a NPMU, headed by a Project director acceptable to theAssociation | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A, 8 | Description :The Recipient shall within one (1) month of the Effective Date,appoint a financial management specialist to the NPMU. | Due Date :31-Jul-2012
Finance Agreement :Section 4.01 (a) | Description :The Financing Agreement between the MRC for the implementation of the Component1 or part of thereof, shall not be suspended | Frequency :Monthly
Finance Agreement :Section 4.01 (b) | Description: Recipient shall adhere to the principles and objective of the MRC, and respectmutually agreed MRC procedures, notably PNPCA | Frequency :Monthly
Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 | Description :the National Steering Committee—Lao PDR referred to in Section 1.A.2 of Schedule 2to this Agreement has been established | Due Date :15-Jun-2012

title.narrative: Number of regulations piloted at the basin level
Submission of the revised Water Law to the National Assembly.
Number of water resource management instruments applied by MONRE in priority basins located in the Lao PDR.
Number of villages receiving livelihood support under the Fisheries component.
Farmers reached with agricultural assets or services
Area provided with improved flood protection
Number of sites in priority river basins where NREI conducts water quality monitoring and information is applied for river basin management.
Farmers reached with agricultural assets or services - Female
Number of new or upgraded DMH hydromet stations that produce information that is applied for water resources management.
Number of communication products produced and disseminated by the MRCS related to IWRM.
Joint Action Plan for addressing a priority transboundary integrated water resources management issues in the Mekong Basin
Number of Joint Issues Paper prepared and endorsed for identified priority transboundary IWRM issues in the Mekong Basin.
Number of new or rehabilitated, functioning fishery hatcheries
Number of functioning Irrigation Water User Associations
Area provided with irrigation and drainage services (ha)
Number of priority river basins where MONRE has applied water resource model packages.
Number of people engaged in the formulation of Fisheries Management Plans (Citizen Engagement)
Number of functional Fishery Management Committees (FMC)
